Articles.Content:
Oh no, I didn\'t mean to imply that I\'d collected the data myself. I suppose I should elaborate.

I\'d first used the program to generate a map off of the CSV in the first post of this thread and was a little dissapointed with the quality as it only had 100 horizontal datapoints and 50 vertical datapoints. I thought this was a result of the data collected so I wanted to get my own and generate a map from that. As I was learning how to do that, my friend came over and politely smacked me in the back of the head reminding me that Surfer defaults to the 100x50 dataset and I had to change that myself. I went back and recalculated it for 1000x1000 and the result was the picture you see before you ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I\'m still planning on collecting my own data, but I won\'t be able to do that for a couple weeks for various reasons, and well ... .... I\'m impatient ;D
A good mate is one that is prepared to smack you over the back of the head when it\'s needed. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

NEW FEATURE

After a hair-raising MechJeb landing, I have put a capsule in this crater-like feature.

> ![ryjcW.png](http://i.imgur.com/ryjcW.png)

I would like to name it The Valley of Death. 

Screenshots:

> ![YSZxC.png](http://i.imgur.com/YSZxC.png)

Coords: 41|31|55 N, 84|10|57 E

As I see maps of the Mun here, can you clarify were Kerbal\'s first Munar landing was exactly?

> ![ksp2011110401044980.png](http://img256.imageshack.us/img256/2424/ksp2011110401044980.png)
> ![ksp2011110320402261.png](http://img827.imageshack.us/img827/8967/ksp2011110320402261.png)

So after playing around in my mapping program using the MÃ¼n data, I figured I\'d try out Kerbin itself!

I had to mess with the colour settings for the elevation as Kerbin\'s oceans and seas are REALLY shallow.

[https://dl.dropbox.com/u/12058883/KerbinSurface.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/12058883/KerbinSurface.png)

Hey, that\'s teh sexeh! Much more detail than I\'m used to seeing.

The colors look a little bit loud, but they\'re also intuitive, and that\'s worth a little glare. Is it just me, or does the map data look like it\'s stretched into a too-large image?

Yeah, it probably is stretched. I\'m not sure of the actual aspect ratio it should be at. And if you think that\'s loud, you should have seen what the program picked (picted?) for the defaults! I toned it way down. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I did another one a little later that was a 3D map you viewed from a 45 degree angle and changed it to top-down. It seemed even more intuitive, but the program insisted on putting a plastic shine on it that I found unattractive. I\'m going to try out another mapping program next week and see if I can get something where the north & south poles aren\'t stretched out so much.
Very nice - well done. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> NEW FEATURE

**Edited <time datetime="2023-04-24T21:50:35Z" title="04/24/2023 09:50  PM" data-short="1 yr">April 24, 2023</time> by BSOM180**

\' is minutes, ' is seconds.

Apparently there\'s a page dedicated to typing the [Degree Symbol](http://degreesymbol.com/)/ Personally, I typically the third option mentioned there: do a search for the degree symbol and copy and paste it in, like so. Â°

Cool feature, landing on remote islands is a KSP pastime of mine ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I use the following for the degrees symbol (without the spaces). Apparently the [noparse] tag doesn\'t exist on these forums >.>

    [sup ]o[/sup ]

Alternatively, you can: hold down the left Alt key, in the num pad type 0176, then release the left Alt key. You should get this Â°

If you\'re Bob Kerman, you type all special characters this way, and have the codes memorized. And you use a slide-rule. :![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Deleted

**Edited <time datetime="2023-04-24T21:50:28Z" title="04/24/2023 09:50  PM" data-short="1 yr">April 24, 2023</time> by BSOM180**

I do Alt Gr+5, then space to make it appear.

BTW, if a feature I want to name is clearly visible from the world map, do I have to land on it to name it?

Precisely, I want to name the indicated mountain chain the PelÃ³ri mountains. Thumbs up to anyone who gets the reference.

> ![kerbin_colour.png](http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/kerbin_colour.png)
That\'s an epic map you have there, how did you make it? Or, if you took it from somewhere else simply to mark that mountain range, where did you find it?

> 
> BTW, if a feature I want to name is clearly visible from the world map, do I have to land on it to name it?

You need to provide 2 screenshots, one of you landed on the mountain chain, and the other from orbit showing the longitude and latitude.

> 
> You need to provide 2 screenshots, one of you landed on the mountain chain, and the other from orbit showing the longitude and latitude.

Here are the pictures. I didn\'t land safely and my MechJeb pod blew up, but the data you need is in these pictures. Please note that they don\'t show the entire chain(except for the first one), so use the map above to show where exactly does it extend.

> ![screenshot11d.png](http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/screenshot11d.png)
> ![screenshot10d.png](http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/screenshot10d.png)
> 
> ![screenshot9.png](http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/screenshot9.png)
> 
> ![screenshot8.png](http://www.majhost.com/gallery/borna123456/GTPlanet/screenshot8.png)

I know this should be in an art-labeled separate thread, and I\'ll kindly take it down and make another thread, but here is a logo prototype for the KGSS. Whaddya think? For some reason you have to follow the link to Photobucket instead of viewing it here. srry ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> [http://i1100.photobucket.com/albums/g417/cookiedamage/kgss.png](http://i1100.photobucket.com/albums/g417/cookiedamage/kgss.png)

> 
> Here are the pictures. I didn\'t land safely and my MechJeb pod blew up, but the data you need is in these pictures. Please note that they don\'t show the entire chain(except for the first one), so use the map above to show where exactly does it extend.

Looks good, the coordinates and a visible attempt at getting there are the main details, which you have provided. Since this is a major feature it will have to go to poll eventually, if no other interest is shown we will probably just add it to our map.

> 
> I know this should be in an art-labeled separate thread, and I\'ll kindly take it down and make another thread, but here is a logo prototype for the KGSS. Whaddya think? For some reason you have to follow the link to Photobucket instead of viewing it here. srry ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > [http://i1100.photobucket.com/albums/g417/cookiedamage/kgss.png](http://i1100.photobucket.com/albums/g417/cookiedamage/kgss.png)

We already have a logo which is shown on the front of the [KGSS Journal](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=14450.0) however, we are looking for artists to make adverts and other magazine features.

> 
> We already have a logo which is shown on the front of the [KGSS Journal](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=14450.0) however, we are looking for artists to make adverts and other magazine features.

Thanks! I think my work would look better as an ad, or something along the lines of a poster. Maybe an advert that hangs on the outside of a building, like NatGeo posters hanging from NYC museums.
Is the persistence file with ships landed at each 'officially' named locations going to be released? Or have I missed seeing it? I see it being talked about, but is there a download?

> 
> Thanks! I think my work would look better as an ad, or something along the lines of a poster. Maybe an advert that hangs on the outside of a building, like NatGeo posters hanging from NYC museums.

When edition 2 comes out it should be clear what kind of items we are looking for. If you think you have ideas you can contribute, then PM them to togfox, or post them in the journal thread ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Is the persistence file with ships landed at each 'officially' named locations going to be released? Or have I missed seeing it? I see it being talked about, but is there a download?

We haven\'t released it yet, I will see about getting a link to it placed in the OP. This will probably be about the time the second edition of the journal is published. I am glad you surrounded official in quotes, otherwise we would be in trouble right now ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> We haven\'t released it yet, I will see about getting a link to it placed in the OP. This will probably be about the time the second edition of the journal is published. I am glad you surrounded official in quotes, otherwise we would be in trouble right now ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Oh dear, I had no idea! Good thing I thought to try to be professional! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Can\'t wait to see \'em. ^^ Now to go find places to name. 8)

attached is the latest Kerbin map with some land marks named. I\'m losing track of regions vs features so we\'ll work it out as we go.

Tim - I\'m not sure where the first Mun landing is. If you can find a post on that then I can add it. Thx. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
